alert.note: Alert for Lewis; Pierce (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 28 at 7:43PM PST until March 02 at 7:25AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Nisqually River Near National affecting Lewis and Pierce Counties. .Heavy rain over the Central and Southern Washington Cascades will come to an end early Tuesday morning. Temperatures in the lower and mid elevations will remain above freezing adding some snow melt to the run off. Precipitation will taper off later Tuesday morning into Tuesday afternoon. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Nisqually River Near National. * WHEN...Until Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 10000.0 cfs, the Nisqually River will flood along the upper reaches of the river from Mt Rainier National Park downstream to Alder Lake. Swift waters will flood roads...pasture lands...and farms. Erosion may damage the river banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM PST Monday the flow was 6470.0 cfs. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest around 13300 cfs late tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood flow is 8000.0 cfs. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by late tonight at 445 AM PST.
